metadata.title: CVE-2010-4530 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Signedness error in ccid_serial.c in libccid in the USB Chip/Smart CardInterface Devices (CCID) driver, as used in pcscd in PCSC-Lite 1.5.3 andpossibly other products, allows physically proximate attackers to executearbitrary code via a smart card with a crafted serial number that causes anegative value to be used in a memcpy operation, which triggers a bufferoverflow. NOTE: some sources refer to this issue as an integer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-4530` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libccid - 1.3.11-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ccid package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.11-2').
